ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: applicational and theoretic at the same time.

to fellow student: TAKE THIS NO MATTER WHAT! OMG THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST COURSE EVER! COMP SCI STUDENT MUST TAKE THIS! STAT STUDENT MUST TAKE THIS! APPLIED MATH STUDENT MUST TAKE THIS! if you are not any of the above... you can do whatever you want.
Yes, but for students who are only interested in theory.
Good / solid introduction to a very important subject with a lot of connections to Statistics.
Yes, I would recommend this course to the students who are interested in information theory.

I would recommend it to any statistics student, just because Yale is so strong in the field and the subject matter plays such an important role in modern statistics. If they are not a statistics student, I would recommend it to anyone with a potential interest in studying in the field. If they are like me and are interested in information theory and its applications, they will thoroughly enjoy the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: yes! loved the deep connection and understandings behind many basic fact in the field that the course offers
I want to research in this field, so it was extremely helpful for me. I also found it very beneficial for the study of statistics and applied math in general.
